question.text:
Which of the following statements regarding the structure of pro-insulin and mature insulin is INCORRECT?

(i) Pro-insulin is made up of three polypeptide chains- A, B, and C.

(ii) C-polypeptide chain with 33 amino acids is removed prior to insulin formation.

(iii) Mature insulin is made up of 51 amino acids arranged in two polypeptide chains- A and B.

(iv) Polypeptide chain A has 30 amino acids and polypeptide chain B has 21 amino acids.

(v) Polypeptide chains A and B are interconnected by only one S - S linkage.

solution.text: Proinsulin has three polypeptide chains-  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> . The mature insulin has only  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> .  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>  polypeptide is removed before the insulin matures. It has 33 amino acids. Mature insulin has 51 amino acids out of which A polypeptide has 21 amino acids and B has 30 amino acids. Polypeptide A and B are interconnected by two disulfide linkages.
